In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function that wraps text based on the specified `text_width`:
```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return lines
end
```
Here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
words = ["This", "is", "a", "long", "sentence", "to", "test", "the", "wrapping"]
lines = wrap_string(words)

for line in lines
    println(line)
end
```
The output will be a series of lines, with each line not exceeding the specified `text_width`.
